member.name: M:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.OPCDAServer.UnregisterServer(System.Guid)

summary.para: Removes the previous OPC Server registration from the system registry. A wrapper for GBDataAccess::GBUnregisterServer method.

You can register your OPC server as a regular COM Server or as an Windows NT service. Note that registering as a service means only the additional LocalService value under the AppID key. You have to create and register a service with the Service Control Manager by yourself.
UnregisterServer calls ThrowExceptionForHR with the resulting HRESULT returned by GBDataAccess::GBUnregisterServer to throw an exception if this method fails.

member.param: A CLSID of the OPC server calss object.

member.name: M:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.OPCDAServer.RegisterServer(System.Guid,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.param: A CLSID of the OPC server calss object.
A vendor specific string providing additional information about the server.
A description of the server class object.
A version independent ProgID of the server. For example, 'SomeOrganization.OPCServer'.
A current version of the server class object. For example, '1.2'. Version dependent ProgID will represent the concatination of versionIndipProgId, point and versionCurrent.

member.name: M:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.OPCDAServer.RegisterServer(System.Guid,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)

summary.para: Registers the OPC server in the system registry. A wrapper for GBDataAccess::GBRegisterServer method.

You can register your OPC server as a regular COM Server or as an Windows NT service. Note that registering as a service means only the additional LocalService value under the AppID key. You have to create and register a service with the Service Control Manager by yourself.

member.para: RegisterServer calls ThrowExceptionForHR with the resulting HRESULT returned by GBDataAccess::GBRegisterServer to throw an exception if this method fails.
member.param: A CLSID of the OPC server calss object.
A vendor specific string providing additional information about the server.
A description of the server class object.
A version independent ProgID of the server. For example, 'SomeOrganization.OPCServer'.
A current version of the server class object. For example, '1.2'. Version dependent ProgID will represent the concatination of versionIndipProgId, point and versionCurrent.
Windows NT service name. If null, then the OPC server will be registered as a regular COM server. Otherwise, the OPC server will be registered as a service.

summary.para: A wrapper for GBDataAccess::GBRevokeClassObject method.
Informs OLE that a class object, previously registered with the RegisterClassObject function, is no longer available for use.
RevokeClassObject calls ThrowExceptionForHR with the resulting HRESULT returned by GBDataAccess::GBRevokeClassObject to throw an exception if this method fails.
A wrapper for GBDataAccess::GBRegisterClassObject method.
Registers an OPC server class object with OLE so client applications can connect to it. Should be called once per OPC server class on the startup.
RegisterClassObject calls ThrowExceptionForHR with the resulting HRESULT returned by GBDataAccess::GBRegisterClassObject to throw an exception if this method fails.

member.name: M:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.OPCDAServer.Initialize(System.Guid,System.Int32,System.Int32,Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ServerOptions,System.Char,System.Int32)
member.param: The CLSID of the COM object representing the OPC server.
The period with which the OPC server cache is scanned for the changes. Any OPC group updaterate will be revised to be a multiple of timeBase.
The minimal update rate, in milliseconds, allowed for OPC groups. The revised updaterate of any OPC group will be the minimal timeBase multiple which is less than minUpdateRate.
Flags affecting the OPC server functionality.
Branch separator for tag names in OPC Server address space hierarchy. It must be an ANSI symbol.
The maximal tags count which can be created in the OPC server address space. Attempt to specify a number greater than the supported tags maximum of your Toolkit version will result in the exception.

member.name: M:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.OPCDAServer.Initialize(System.Guid,System.Int32,System.Int32,Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ServerOptions,System.Char,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)

summary.para: Initializes the OPC Server and the Toolkit library. A wrapper for GBDataAccess::GBInitialize method.
Initialize must be called prior to any other OPCDAServer member functions.
Initialize calls ThrowExceptionForHR with the resulting HRESULT returned by GBDataAccess::GBInitialize to throw an exception if Initialize method fails.

member.param: The CLSID of the COM object representing the OPC server.
The period with which the OPC server cache is scanned for the changes. Any OPC group updaterate will be revised to be a multiple of timeBase.
The minimal update rate, in milliseconds, allowed for OPC groups. The revised updaterate of any OPC group will be the minimal timeBase multiple which is less than minUpdateRate.
Flags affecting the OPC server functionality.
Branch separator for tag names in OPC Server address space hierarchy. It must be an ANSI symbol.
The maximal tags count which can be created in the OPC server address space. Attempt to specify a number greater than the supported tags maximum of your Toolkit version will result in the exception.
The major version of the OPC server, which is reported to the OPC clients.
The minor version of the OPC server, which is reported to the OPC clients.
The build number of the OPC server, which is reported to the OPC clients.
A vendor specific string providing additional information about the OPC server.

member.name: M:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.OPCDAServer.Shutdown(System.String)

summary.para: Shuts down this OPC server. A wrapper for GBDataAccessBase::GBShutdown method.
This method will send IOPCShutdown::ShutdownRequest callback to all client advised IOPCShutdown connection point. Server functioning will stop and it can't be resumed later.

member.returns: false if error has occurred, otherwise true.
member.param: An optional text string indicating the reason for the shutdown. Pass null if you don't wish to specify the reason.

member.name: M:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.OPCDAServer.Resume

summary.para: Resumes this OPC server. A wrapper for GBDataAccessBase::GBResume method.
Resumes OPC server, which was previously suspended with Suspend method, and sets it status to OPC_STATUS_RUNNING.

member.returns: false if error has occurred, otherwise true.

member.name: M:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.OPCDAServer.Suspend

summary.para: Suspends this OPC server. A wrapper for GBDataAccessBase::GBSuspend method.

Sets the server status to OPC_STATUS_SUSPENDED and suspends its functioning. While in this state, OPC server ignores most of the client calls, doesn't process data and doesn't send updates (OnDataChange callbacks).
Call Resume to resume the OPC server functions.

member.returns: false if error has occurred, otherwise true.

member.name: M:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.OPCDAServer.SetState(Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ServerState)

summary.para: Sets the server state. A wrapper for GBDataAccessBase::GBSetState method.
This method doesn't affect the OPC server behavior. It only affects the status which OPC clients will recieve via IOPCServer::GetStatus.

member.returns: false if error has occurred, otherwise true.
member.param: A new OPC server state.

member.name: M:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.OPCDAServer.GetBandwidth

summary.para: Used to determine the bandwidth of the OPC server. A wrapper for GBDataAccessBase::GBGetBandwidth method.
This method returns the worst bandwidth among all of the OPC server instances.
GetBandwidth returns zero is bandwidth is undefiened

member.returns: The bandwidth of this OPC server.

summary.para: Creates a new OPC server tag. A wrapper for GBDataAccessBase::GBCreateItem, GBDataAccessBase::GBCreateItemAnalog or GBDataAccessBase::GBCreateItemEnum method depending on which overload is called.
UpdateTags calls ThrowExceptionForHR with the resulting HRESULT returned by the underlying GBDataAccessBase method to throw an exception if CreateTag method fails.

member.returns: The TagId identifier of the created tag.
member.param: Arbitrary UserId tag identifier. This value will be passed to the Toolkit event handlers. Its meaning is left for your consideration.
A fully qualified tag name.
Indicates if this tag is read only, write only or read/write.
Flags. A combination of bits used to modify the way the Toolkit will proccess this tag.
Indicates the type of Engineering Units (EU) information (if any) contained in euInfo.

EU information. Its value depends on euType. If euType is EUType.noEnum then euInfo must be null. If euType is EUType.analog then euInfo must contain an array of two doubles indicating LOW and HI EU range. If euType is EUType.enumerated then euInfo must contain an array of strings which describe every possible tag value (first string in euType corresponds to a zero value, second corresponds to 1 and so on).
An Object containing the tags initial data value in its canonical data type.

member.param: If true then EndUpdate waits for the update transaction to complete (new data is stored into the OPC server cache), otherwise the update transaction is carried out asynchronously.

summary.para: Starts the transaction of OPC server secondary cache update. A wrapper for GBDataAccessBase::BeginUpdate method.

summary.para: Occures when the client reads the values of the tag's properties.
This event is a wrapper for the native GBDataAccessBase::GBOnGetProperties callback.

Invoked when one of the following occures: 1) The client tries to validate a tag that is not yet created. 2) The client tries to add a tag to a group, and this tag is not yet created. 3) The client tries to read or write a tag that is not yet created. 4) The client tries to read properties of a tag that is not yet created.
This event is a wrapper for the native GBDataAccessBase::GBOnQueryItem callback.
Occures when the OPC client requests a list of the tag's access paths.
This event is a wrapper for the native GBDataAccessBase::GBOnBrowseAccessPath callback.
Occures when the client requests a list of locales supported by the server.
This event is a wrapper for the native GBDataAccessBase::GBOnQueryLocales callback.
Occures when the OPC client queries for the error description.
This event is a wrapper for the native GBDataAccessBase::GBOnGetErrorString callback.
Occures when some tags becomes inactive. It happens when no more OPC clients are waiting for these tags to be updated and their values to be sent to the clients.
This event is a wrapper for the native GBDataAccessBase::GBOnDeactivate callback.

Occures when some tags becomes active. It happens when the OPC client requests these tags to be periodically updated from the underlying devices and their values to be sent to the clients via IOPCDataCallback.
This event is a wrapper for the native GBDataAccessBase::GBOnActivate callback.
Occures when the OPC server has sent a data update to the client.
This event is a wrapper for the native GBDataAccessBase::GBDataUpdate callback.
To enable this event, set ServerOptions.NotifyDataUpdates flag then you call OPCDAServer.Initialize.
WARNING. Handling this event may cause a significant decrease in performance because of a massive data marshaling from native to managed code.
Occures when the OPC client requests tag reading from the DEVICE. Its handler must poll the underlying devices and place the new tags values into the OPC server cache.
This event is a wrapper for the native GBDataAccessBase::GBOnReadItems callback.
Invoked when the OPC client writes new data to the OPC server's tags.
This event is a wrapper for the native GBDataAccessBase::GBOnWriteItems callback.

Occures when the last instance of an OPC server is destroyed. It the ServerReleased event handler you can decide whether to allow the OPC clients to connect to the server later or to suspend the OPC server class object.
This event is a wrapper for the native GBDataAccessBase::GBOnServerReleased callback.
Invoked when the class factory lock counter is decremented.
This event is a wrapper for the native GBDataAccessBase::GBOnUnLock callback.
Invoked when the class factory lock counter is incremented.
This event is a wrapper for the native GBDataAccessBase::GBOnLock callback.
Occures when the instance of an OPC server is destroyed.
This event is a wrapper for the native GBDataAccessBase::GBOnDestroyInstance callback.
Occures when the new instance of an OPC server is created.
This event is a wrapper for the native GBDataAccessBase::GBOnCreateInstance callback.
This event is invoked by the class factory immediately before the creation of a new OPC server instance. In its handler you may decide whether to allow the OPC client to connect to the OPC server.
This event is a wrapper for the native GBDataAccessBase::GBOnBeforeCreateInstance callback.

member.name: P:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ReadPropertiesArgs.EventHandlingError
member.summary: Gets or sets the event handing error. A value of ErrorCodes.Ok means success.

member.name: P:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ReadPropertiesArgs.Errors
member.summary: Gets an array object there the individual reading return codes for each property should be stored. Before the handler is invoked, Errors is filled with ErrorCodes.InvalidPropertyId values. If your handler processes a property with the PropID of Properties[i], then it must store it's value to Values[i] and store the reading error to Error[i]. All properties that were not processed by the handler (the corresponding Error[i] is still ErrorCodes.InvalidPropertyId) will be processed by the Toolkit.

member.name: P:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ReadPropertiesArgs.Values
member.summary: Gets an array object there the propties values sohuld be stored. The values must me storted in their canonical data types.

member.summary: Gets the ItemId structure that identifies the tag for which the properties values are requested.

member.summary: Gets the array containing the PropID identifiers of the properties those values are requested.

member.summary: Gets the locale identifier that can be used to determine the language of the property value (if it is a textual value). This value may be a default locale (LOCALE_SYSTEM_DEFAULT, LOCALE_USER_DEFAULT, or a sublanguage-neutral locale).

member.name: P:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ReadPropertiesArgs.Culture
member.summary: Gets the CultureInfo object that can be used to determine the language of the property value (if it is a textual value). Culture corresponds to a value of the Locale property. If the Locale represents the default locale (LOCALE_SYSTEM_DEFAULT, LOCALE_USER_DEFAULT, or a sublanguage-neutral locale), then Culture gets the CultureInfo object, constructed from the LCID returned by ConvertDefaultLocale method called with that default locale as an argument.

member.name: P:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ReadItemsArgs.ValuesAcceptable
member.summary: Gets the value that is true if the event handler may store somthing into Values, Qualities, Timestamps and Errors properties. Event may be invoked as result of the OPC client request to refresh tags of some OPC group form the DEVICE. Such request can be a call to IOPCAsyncIO2::Refresh2 or IOPCAsyncIO3::RefreshMaxAge. It such case ValuesAcceptable will return false.

member.name: P:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ReadItemsArgs.ValuesReturned
member.summary: The event handler must set this property to true if it placed something in Values, Qualities, Timestamps and Errors properties. Do not set ValuesReturned to true if ValuesAcceptable is false.

member.name: P:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ReadItemsArgs.ValuesReturnedPartial
member.summary: The event handler may set this property to true if it is needed to return the calling OPC client values, qualities and timestamps from Values, Qualities and Timestamps arrays for only a part of tags, identified by ItemIds, and pass values, qualities and timestamps from the server's cache for the rest of the tags. If ValuesReturnedPartial set to true, then the ItemIds[i].TagId must be forced to zero for each tag for which the event handler stored it's value, quality and timestamp into Value[i], Quality[i] and Timestamp[i].

member.name: P:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ReadItemsArgs.Locale
member.summary: Gets the locale identifier that should be used to process the Values. This value may be a default locale (LOCALE_SYSTEM_DEFAULT, LOCALE_USER_DEFAULT, or a sublanguage-neutral locale).

member.name: P:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ReadItemsArgs.Culture
member.summary: Gets the CultureInfo object that should be used to process the Values. Culture corresponds to a value of the Locale property. If the Locale represents the default locale (LOCALE_SYSTEM_DEFAULT, LOCALE_USER_DEFAULT, or a sublanguage-neutral locale), then Culture gets the CultureInfo object, constructed from the LCID returned by ConvertDefaultLocale method called with that default locale as an argument.

member.name: P:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ReadItemsArgs.ClientId
member.summary: Gets the identifier of a calling client (ClientId), which was set earlier in the BeforeCreateInstance event handler.

member.name: P:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ReadItemsArgs.MasterQuality
member.summary: Gets or sets the master quality of a reading operation. MasterQuality must be set to ErrorCodes.False if some of the Qualities were set to a value representing a bad or an uncertain quality.

member.name: P:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ReadItemsArgs.MasterError
member.summary: Gets or sets the master error of a reading operation. MasterError must be set to ErrorCodes.False if some of the Errors were set to a value other than ErrorCodes.Ok.

member.name: P:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ReadItemsArgs.Errors
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of errors of the tags, identified by ItemIds. If the ValuesAcceptable property is false, then Errors property is not accessible and must not be used. Errors is initialized to null then the event handler is called. Errors indicates the success of the individual tag reads. If some of Errors[i] is set to a value other than ErrorCodes.Ok, then you must set the MasterError to ErrorCodes.False.

member.name: P:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ReadItemsArgs.Timestamps
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of UTC timestamps of the tags, identified by ItemIds. If the ValuesAcceptable property is false, then Timestamps property is not accessible and must not be used. Timestamps is initialized to null then the event handler is called.

member.name: P:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ReadItemsArgs.Qualities
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of qualities of the tags, identified by ItemIds. If the ValuesAcceptable property is false, then Qualities property is not accessible and must not be used. Qualities is initialized to null then the event handler is called. If you store a bad or an uncertain quality to Qualities[i], then you must set the MasterQuality to ErrorCodes.False.

member.name: P:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ReadItemsArgs.Values
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of data values of the tags, identified by ItemIds. If the ValuesAcceptable property is false, then Values property is not accessible and must not be used. Values is initialized to null then the event handler is called.

member.name: P:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ReadItemsArgs.ItemIds
member.summary: Gets the array of an OPC item identifiers. Your implementation must ignore all ItemIds[i] for which ItemIds[i].TagId is zero. Some of ItemIds[i].TagId may be forced to zero if the event handler sets the ValuesReturnedPartial property to true (see ValuesReturnedPartial description for details).

member.name: P:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ReadItemsArgs.Count
member.summary: Gets the count of the OPC items being read.

member.summary: Gets the CultureInfo object that should be used to process the Values. Culture corresponds to a value of the Locale property. member.summary: Gets the identifier of a calling client (ClientId), which was set earlier in the BeforeCreateInstance event handler.

member.summary: Gets or sets the master error of a writing operation. MasterError must be set to ErrorCodes.False if some of the Errors were set to a value other than ErrorCodes.Ok.

member.name: P:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.WriteItemsArgs.Count
member.summary: Gets the length of the ItemIds array.

member.name: P:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.WriteItemsArgs.TimestampsSpecified
member.summary: Get a variable that is true when the Timestamps array is specified. If TimestampsSpecified is false then the Timestamps property is null and your event handler must not use it. TimestampsSpecified can be false if the OPC client called a method of OPC DA2 interface, where writing the tag timestamp is not supported.

member.name: P:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.WriteItemsArgs.QualitiesSpecified
member.summary: Get a variable that is true when the Qualities array is specified. If QualitiesSpecified is false then the Qualities property is null and your event handler must not use it. QualitiesSpecified can be false if the OPC client called a method of OPC DA2 interface, where writing the tag quality is not supported.

member.name: P:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.WriteItemsArgs.CopyToCache
member.summary: Gets or sets a variable indicating whether the Toolkit must copy data from Values, Qualities, Timestamps and Errors to the OPC server cache.

member.name: P:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.WriteItemsArgs.Errors
member.summary: Gets the array of ErrorCodes indicating the success of the individual tag writes. Errors array is initialized with ErrorCodes.Ok values. If the error has occured while writing a tag, identified by ItemIds[i], then you sohuld store a code of this error to Errors[i] and set MasterError to ErrorCodes.False.

member.name: P:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.WriteItemsArgs.Timestamps
member.summary: Gets the readonly array containing the new timestamps of a tags, identified by ItemIds. Timestamps will be null if the client is using OPC DA2 interface. It this case TimestampsSpecified property is false. Timestamps[i] can be FileTime.Unspecified. It means that client don't want to write a timestamp of a tag, identified by the ItemIds[i].

member.name: P:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.WriteItemsArgs.Qualities
member.summary: Gets the readonly array containing the new qualities of a tags, identified by ItemIds. Qualities will be null if the client is using OPC DA2 interface. It this case QualitiesSpecified property is false. Qualities[i] can be Quality.Unspecified. It means that client don't want to write a quality of a tag, identified by the ItemIds[i].

member.name: P:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.WriteItemsArgs.Values
member.summary: Gets the readonly array containing the new data values of a tags, identified by ItemIds. Values[i] can be null. It means that client don't want to write a data value of a tag, identified by the ItemIds[i].

member.name: P:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.WriteItemsArgs.ItemIds
member.summary: Gets the array of an OPC item identifiers. Your implementation must ignore all ItemIds[i] for which ItemIds[i].TagId is zero. You may force ItemIds[i].TagId to zero to prevent the corresponding tag to be written (if CopyToCache is set to false, then it will have no effect).

member.summary: One or more arguments are invalid.

member.summary: Ran out of memory.

member.summary: Access denied.

member.summary: The method is not implemented.

member.summary: An unexpected error has occured.

member.summary: The operation was aborted.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ErrorCodes.Fail
member.summary: The operation has failed.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ErrorCodes.Ok

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ErrorCodes.LowAuthentication
member.summary: Server expected higher level of package privacy.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ErrorCodes.LowImpersonation
member.summary: Server requires higher impersonation level to access secured data.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ErrorCodes.PrivateActive
member.summary: A session using private OPC credentials is already active.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ErrorCodes.NotSupported
member.summary: The server does not support writing of quality and/or timestamp.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ErrorCodes.RateNotSet
member.summary: There is no sampling rate set for the specified item.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ErrorCodes.QueueOverflow
member.summary: Not every detected change has been returned since the server's buffer reached its limit and had to purge out the oldest data.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ErrorCodes.InvalidContinuationPoint
member.summary: The continuation point is not valid.

member.summary: The server does not support buffering of data items that are collected at a faster rate than the group update rate.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ErrorCodes.DeadBandNotSupported
member.summary: The item does not support deadband.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ErrorCodes.DeadbandNotSet
member.summary: The item deadband has not been set for this item.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ErrorCodes.InvalidPropertyId
member.summary: The specified property ID is not valid for the item.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ErrorCodes.NotFound
member.summary: The requested object (e.g. a public group) was not found.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ErrorCodes.InvalidConfig
member.summary: The server's configuration file is an invalid format.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ErrorCodes.InUse
member.summary: The operation cannot be performed because the object is bering referenced.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ErrorCodes.Clamped
member.summary: A value passed to write was accepted but the output was clamped.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ErrorCodes.UnsupportedRate

member.summary: Duplicate name not allowed.

member.name: T:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ServerOptions
member.summary: The set of flags used to modify the OPC server behavior.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ServerOptions.NotifyDataUpdates
member.summary: If set, then DataUpdate event is enabled. If this flag is not set, then DataUpdate event won't be invoked even if it is advised. WARNING, using DataUpdate event may significantly reduce .NET OPC Server performance because of a massive native to managed data marshaling. Use with care.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ServerOptions.AlwaysDevice
member.summary: If set, then any OPC Client read request, both DEVICE and CACHE, will cause ReadItems event to be invoked. Otherwise ReadItems event is invoked, then the reading is performed with DEVICE datasource only.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ServerOptions.DefaultOverrideQuality
member.summary: If set, then the default quality for the tags, being written by the OPC Clients, is OPC_QUALITY_LOCAL_OVERRIDE. Otherwise it is OPC_QUALITY_GOOD.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ServerOptions.GroupCheckLocale
member.summary: If set, then the LCID check is performed each time the OPC Client tries to create an OPC Group or set it's locale. Only LCIDs which are supported by the OPC Server are accepted. If this bit is not set, then any LCID is accepted for OPC Groups.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ServerOptions.ReturnAnyEUInfo
member.summary: If set the property 8 (Item EU Info) value will be reported for any engineering units type. Otherwise, the property 8 will be returned for the enumerated tags only.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ServerOptions.FreeStrings
member.summary: Used internally.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ServerOptions.NoAccessPaths
member.summary: Ignore OPC item access paths. If your OPC Server does not use access paths, then this bit should be set to one in order to ensure its compliance this OPC Data Access specification.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ServerOptions.ChildlessTags
member.summary: OPC DA3 servers only. If this flag is set, then the toolkit will assume, that tags can't have any children. This doesn't mean that there can be no tag folders in the address space hierarchy. If set, AssumeChildlessTags flag is ignored.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ServerOptions.AssumeChildlessTags
member.summary: OPC DA3 servers only. When the OPC Client browses the server address space it will be reported that all of the tags (tags, not the folders conotaing tags) possibly has children tags. Such behavior is acceptable by the specification. This can improve performance if server has a large amount of tags (about 10000 and more). If this flag is not set, then OPC Server will find out exactly whether the tag has any children or not.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.ServerOptions.Default
member.summary: The default value (zero).

member.name: T:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.TagOptions
member.summary: The set of flags used to modify the way the Toolkit will process the OPC tag.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.TagOptions.DontCopyName
member.summary: Useless in CLR environment. Do not use.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.TagOptions.CanonicalOnly
member.summary: If set then OPC clients are allowed to request the tag value in its canonical data type only.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.TagOptions.DontCompareValues
member.summary: If set then tag value will be sent to OPC Clients via IOPCDataCallback interface every time its timestamp changes, even if its value has not changed.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.TagOptions.Default
member.summary: The default value (zero).

member.summary: Defines bit masks for the quality.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.QualityMasks.qualityMask
member.summary: These bits hold the quality status and substatus.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.QualityMasks.limitMask
member.summary: These bits hold the limit status.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.QualityMasks.vendorMask
member.summary: These bits are available for vendor specific use.

member.name: T:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.QualityBits
member.summary: Defines the possible quality status bits.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.QualityBits.goodLocalOverride
member.summary: The value has been Overridden. Typically this is means the input has been disconnected and a manually entered value has been forced.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.QualityBits.good
member.summary: The value is good. There are no special conditions.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.QualityBits.uncertainSubNormal
member.summary: The value is derived from multiple sources and has less than the required number of Good sources.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.QualityBits.uncertainEUExceeded
member.summary: The returned value is outside the limits defined for this parameter. Note that in this case (per the Fieldbus Specification) the Limits field indicates which limit has been exceeded but does NOT necessarily imply that the value cannot move farther out of range.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.QualityBits.uncertainSensorNotAccurate
member.summary: Either the value has pegged at one of the sensor limits (in which case the limit field should be set to 1 or 2) or the sensor is otherwise known to be out of calibration via some form of internal diagnostics (in which case the limit field should be 0).

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.QualityBits.uncertainLastUsableValue
member.summary: Whatever was writing this value has stopped doing so. The returned value should be regarded as stale.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.QualityBits.uncertain
member.summary: The quality of the value is uncertain. There is no specific reason why the value is uncertain.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.QualityBits.badWaitingForInitialData
member.summary: After Items are added to a group, it may take some time for the server to actually obtain values for these items. In such cases the client might perform a read (from cache), or establish a ConnectionPoint based subscription and/or execute a Refresh on such a subscription before the values are available. OPC DA 3.0 or newer servers.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.QualityBits.badOutOfService
member.summary: The block is off scan or otherwise locked. This quality is also used when the active state of the item or the group containing the item is InActive.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.QualityBits.badCommFailure
member.summary: Communications have failed. There is no last known value is available.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.QualityBits.badLastKnownValue
member.summary: Communications have failed. However, the last known value is available.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.QualityBits.badSensorFailure
member.summary: A sensor failure had been detected (the Limits field can provide additional diagnostic information in some situations).

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.QualityBits.badDeviceFailure
member.summary: A device failure has been detected.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.QualityBits.badNotConnected
member.summary: The input is required to be logically connected to something but is not. This quality may reflect that no value is available at this time, for reasons like the value may have not been provided by the data source.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.QualityBits.badConfigurationError
member.summary: There is some server specific problem with the configuration. For example the item in question has been deleted from the configuration.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.QualityBits.bad
member.summary: The value is bad but no specific reason is known.

member.name: T:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.LimitBits
member.summary: Defines the possible limit status bits.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.LimitBits.constant
member.summary: The value is a constant and cannot move.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.LimitBits.high
member.summary: The value has pegged at some high limit.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.LimitBits.low
member.summary: The value has pegged at some lower limit.

member.name: F:Graybox.OPC.ServerToolkit.CLRWrapper.LimitBits.none
member.summary: The value is free to move up or down.
